info.title: Sourcify APIv2
info.description:
Welcome to the Sourcify's APIv2.

Important differences between the deprecated legacy API and the new APIv2:
- **Ticketing**: The verfication requests resolve into tickets/verification jobs. 
  - Previously the verification happened during the HTTP request, which resulted in timeouts if compilation took longer
- **Standard JSON as default**: In the current design we take the standard JSON format as our main verification endpoint. Other methods such as "multi-file" or "single-file" should be handled by frontends or tooling to format into std-json. We still support verification with metadata at `/v2/verify/metadata`.
- **Lean API**: We keep the number of endpoints minimal compared to v1. We won't have a session API. 
- **Detailed contract response**: Prev. we only returned contract files of a contract. Now we can return details at `/contract/{chainId}/{address}`.

servers.description: Local development server address on default port 5555.

tags.name: Contract Lookup
tags.description: API v2 - Tools and endpoints for looking up contract information

tags.name: Verify Contracts
tags.description: API v2 - Submit a contract for verification

tags.name: Verification Jobs
tags.description: API v2 - Check the status of a verification job

tags.name: (Deprecated) Stateless Verification
tags.description: API v1 - Main verification endpoints - Deprecated. Please verify via API v2 instead.

tags.name: (Deprecated) Repository
tags.description: API v1 - Access to already verified contracts and files. - Deprecated. Please use the API v2 Contract Lookup instead.

tags.name: (Deprecated) Session Verification
tags.description: API v1 - Used by the Sourcify UI to verify contracts. Not intended for external usage. Will require CORS.

get.summary: Health check endpoint

200.description: Server is healthy

get.summary: Get version information
get.description: Returns version information for the server and its dependencies, along with the git commit hash

200.description: Version information

gitCommitHash.description: Git commit hash the server was built from

get.summary: Get the list of supported and deprecated chains

200.description: List of supported chains

index.description: Index of the RPC in the rpc array

supported.description: Whether the chain is supported for verification

etherscanAPI.description: Whether Etherscan API is available for this chain

get.summary: Redirect to verification UI
get.description: This endpoint redirects to the Sourcify verification UI (verify.sourcify.dev). Useful for tooling to take a single Sourcify server URL (e.g. https://sourcify.dev/server) and provide verify links with that base URL.

get.summary: Redirect to repository UI
get.description: This endpoint redirects to the Sourcify repository UI (repo.sourcify.dev). Useful for tooling to take a single Sourcify server URL (e.g. https://sourcify.dev/server) and provide repo links with that base URL.

post.summary: Private endpoint for verifying contracts on deprecated chains.
post.description:
This endpoint is used to submit verifications for contracts on deprecated chains. The endpoint puts placeholders for the onchain data such as the onchain bytecodes or tx hashes, as such data can't be fetched from a chain that is no longer live.

Useful for example when we get an old dataset of verified contracts and we want to verify on old chains.

200.description: The contract has been successfully checked or sourcified

result.message: Chain #1 does not have a contract deployed at 0x....

value.error: Metadata file not found. Did you include "metadata.json"?
Unexpected token ' in JSON at position 107
Couldn't extract files from the request. Please make sure you have added files
Resource missing; unsuccessful fetching: contracts/SingleFile.sol
The deployed and recompiled bytecode don't match.

post.summary: Private endpoint for replacing contract data in the database.
post.description:
Replaces an existing contract in the database, addressing issues with misaligned or incorrect contract data.
This endpoint provides a generic, maintainable solution and optimizes performance by optionally skipping 
recompilation and on-chain RPC calls, using data already stored in the database.

chainId.description: The chain ID of the contract

forceCompilation.description: If true, recompiles the contract using the provided jsonInput, compilerVersion and compilationTarget

forceRPCRequest.description: If true, fetches the contract's information from the RPC

jsonInput.description: Required if forceCompilation is true. The JSON input to use for recompilation

compilerVersion.description: Required if forceCompilation is true. The compiler version to use for recompilation

compilationTarget.description: Required if forceCompilation is true. The compilation target to use for recompilation

customReplaceMethod.description:
Specifies the custom database update strategy to use when replacing contract data. 
Available methods:
- "replace-creation-information": Updates an existing verified contract's creation bytecode, 
  deployment transaction details (hash, block number, transaction index, deployer), and 
  creation match status while preserving the runtime verification data. This method is 
  useful for correcting incomplete or missing creation data on contracts that were 
  previously verified only against runtime bytecode.
- "replace-metadata": Updates only the metadata of an existing verified contract.

200.description: The contract has been successfully replaced.

rpcFailedFetchingCreationBytecode.description: Indicates if the RPC call to fetch the creation bytecode failed

value.error: jsonInput, compilerVersion and compilationTarget are required when forceCompilation is true
The contract is not verified or the verification is not perfect
Database service not available
Error during replacement process

post.description:
Submit a contract for verification via the [Solidity standard JSON input](https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/latest/using-the-compiler.html#input-description) or [Vyper JSON input](https://docs.vyperlang.org/en/stable/compiling-a-contract.html#input-json-description).

There are no "single file" or "multi-part" verification endpoints because those are essentially wrappers around the Solidity compiler's JSON interface. The verification frontend can provide files and settings options to resemble these.

You can optionally pass the `creationTransactionHash` to make Sourcify reliably fetching the creation bytecode. Otherwise, it will try to fetch it itself which is dependent on external services.

**Note**: The `outputSelection` field in the `stdJsonInput.settings` will be overridden during verification to ensure all necessary artifacts are generated.

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: The chainId number of the EVM chain

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Contract's 20 byte address in hex string with the 0x prefix. Case insensitive.

stdJsonInput.description:
Full [standard JSON object](https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/latest/using-the-compiler.html#input-description) to pass to the compiler. 

Must include the `language` field inside the stdJsonInput object. Currently supports Solidity and Vyper.

contractIdentifier.description: The fully qualified file path and contract name to indicate which contract to verify.

allOf.description: The hash of the transaction that created this contract. Optional.

202.description:
Successfully submitted the verification. The server started to process the verification. 

You can follow the verification status via the returned `verificationId` at `GET /v2/verify/{verificationId}`

customCode.description: A string token to indicate the reason of the error

post.description:
Starts a verification job that searches the Sourcify database for contracts whose
runtime bytecode is similar to the contract deployed at the given address. The job will
attempt to verify against each candidate until a match is found or the candidate list is exhausted.

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: The chainId number of the EVM chain

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Contract's 20 byte address in hex string with the 0x prefix. Case insensitive.

allOf.description: The hash of the transaction that created this contract. Optional.

202.description:
Successfully submitted the verification. The server started to process the verification. 

You can follow the verification status via the returned `verificationId` at `GET /v2/verify/{verificationId}`

get.summary: Check verification job status
get.description:
Endpoint to get the status of a verification job.

Alternatively you can directly check the verification status of a contract with with chainId+address at `GET /v2/contract/{chainId}/{address}`

parameters.name: verificationId
parameters.description: Verification Job ID returned from the server for a verification request.

200.description:
The verification job completed either with success or failure. This endpoint returns `200` even if the verification job fails. Check the `contract.match` field and `error` for verification statuses.

If the job is not completed yet (i.e. pending), the `isJobCompleted` will be false.

examples.message: The onchain and recompiled bytecodes don't match.

customCode.description: A string token to indicate the reason of the error

message.example: The chain with chainId 3153212 is not supported for verification

examples.message: The chain with chainId 9429413 is not supported

allOf.description: Optional, when the verification fails for some reason.

compilationTime.description: Time it took to compile the contract on the server in milliseconds.

externalVerifications.description: Links to external verification status endpoints on Etherscan-alike services.

etherscan.description: Status metadata for the verification job mirrored on an external explorer API.

verificationId.description: Identifier returned by the external verifier when the job was created.

error.description: Error message returned by the external verifier. Present when the verification failed.

statusUrl.description: Direct URL to query the verification status from the explorer API.

explorerUrl.description: Direct URL to the block explorer page for the contract

get.summary: Get verified contract
get.description:
By default returns minimal information about the contract: `match`, `creation_match`, `runtime_match`, `chainId`, `address`, and `verifiedAt`

To get other details one can either list the fields requested in the `fields` query param or ask all fields but omit several with `omit`. To get everything just pass `fields=all`.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma seperated fields to include in the response. Can also take `all`

parameters.name: omit
parameters.description: Comma seperated fields to NOT include in the response. All fields except matching ones will be returned. Can't be used simultanously with `fields`.

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: The chainId number of the EVM chain

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Contract's 20 byte address in hex string with the 0x prefix. Case insensitive.

200.description: Example response

address.title: Address
address.description: Contract Address in hex string. Can be checksummed or not (i.e. can contain capital letters)

allOf.description: CborAuxdata that is found on the recompiled bytecode.

id.description: Does not exist on `constructorArguments`. Used to find the corresponding value of the Transformation in the TransformationValues dictionary

type.description: `insert` when the transformation value is appended to the bytecode e.g. constructor arguments

reason.description: Keep in mind the `library` reason is singular here but plural in the TransformationValues dictionary: `libraries`

cborAuxdata.description:
Different format than the `cborAuxdata` field under the bytecode object. 

Will be here only if there was a transformation on the cborAuxdata. If cborAuxdatas matched, there won't be a transformation.

allOf.description: CborAuxdata that is found on the recompiled bytecode.

id.description: Does not exist on `callProtection`. Used to find the corresponding value of the Transformation in the TransformationValues dictionary

type.description: Runtime bytecode transformations won't have `insert`, because runtime does not have constructor arguments to be appended.

reason.description: Keep in mind the `library` and `immutable` reasons are singular here but plural in the TransformationValues dictionary: `libraries` and `immutables`

cborAuxdata.description:
Different format than the `cborAuxdata` field under the bytecode object. 

Will be here only if there was a transformation on the cborAuxdata. If cborAuxdatas matched, there won't be a transformation.

deployer.title: Address
deployer.description: Contract Address in hex string. Can be checksummed or not (i.e. can contain capital letters)

allOf.description: The server accepts v prefixed but should only respond without the v prefix

id.description: The AST IDs of the sources

stdJsonInput.description: The input fields conforming the compiler standard-JSON format.

stdJsonOutput.description: The outputs conforming the compiler standard JSON format

id.description: The AST IDs of the sources

contracts.description:
Contracts output in the standard JSON format.

This will only contain the entry for the compilaton target contract, even if the `outputSelection` was `*`.

bytecode.description: In Sourcify we refer to this field more explicitly as "creation bytecode"

allOf.description: Without the 0x prefix, as in the compiler output format

deployedBytecode.description: In Sourcify we refer to this field more explicitly as "runtime bytecode"

allOf.description: Without the 0x prefix, as in the compiler output format

signatures.description: The signatures of the contract grouped by type (function, event, error).

signatureHash4.description: The 4-byte selector (first 4 bytes of the 32-byte hash)

get.summary: Get verified contract at an address on all chains
get.description:
Returns all verified deployments at an address on all Sourcify chains (including deprecated ones).

Success returns an array of VerifiedContractMinimal objects under `results` field.

If not verified on any chain, the `results` array will be empty.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Contract's 20 byte address in hex string with the 0x prefix. Case insensitive.

200.description: Returns all verified deployments at an address on all Sourcify chains

address.title: Address
address.description: Contract Address in hex string. Can be checksummed or not (i.e. can contain capital letters)

get.summary: List of verified contracts per chain
get.description: Retrieve the verified contracts on a chain

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorts the contracts by most recent first (`desc`, default), or by oldest first (`asc`)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of contracts that should be returned per page. Maximum 200

parameters.name: afterMatchId
parameters.description: The last `matchId` returned to get contracts older or newer than it (depending on `sort`)

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: The chainId number of the EVM chain

200.description:
Returns an array of VerifiedContractMinimal objects under `results` field.

If not verified on any chain, the `results` array will be empty.

post.description:
Sends provided files for verification. 

The `chosenContract` is the optional index of the contract to be verified and only needed when there are multiple contracts, i.e. multiple metadata.json in the provided body. For example a full hardhat-output contains metadatas of all contracts compiled.

example.SimpleStorage.sol: pragma solidity ^0.8.0; contract SimpleStorage { function get() public view returns (uint) { return 1; } }

chosenContract.description: Optional index for the contract if multiple contracts (i.e. metadata.json files) are present.
Optional index for the contract if multiple contracts (i.e. metadata.json files) are present.

get.summary: Get a specific file from the repository with the file path (static serving)
get.description: Retrieve statically served files over the server.

parameters.name: matchType
parameters.description: Either `full_match` or `partial_match`

200.description: The file is found at the path

404.description: The file is not found at the path

get.summary: Check if contracts are verified (full or partial match) by addresses and chain IDs
get.description: Checks if contract with the desired chain and address is verified and in the repository. It will search for both perfect and partial matches.

parameters.name: addresses
parameters.description: Comma seperated string of addresses to check for.

parameters.name: chainIds
parameters.description: Comma separated string of chain IDs.

parameters.name: resolveProxies
parameters.description: Check if the contracts are proxies and what their implementations are.

200.description: OK. Also returns `200` with status `false` when not found

get.summary: Check if contracts are verified (full match) by addresses and chain IDs
get.description: Checks if contract with the desired chain and address is verified and in the repository. It will search only the perfect matches.

parameters.name: addresses
parameters.description: The addresses of the contracts.

parameters.name: chainIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the chains.

200.description: OK

get.summary: Get all files of a contract (full and partial match)
get.description: Returns all files for the desired contract with the address and chain. Searches both full and partial matches.

200.description: Contract is available

get.summary: Get all files of a contract (full match)
get.description: Returns all files for the desired contract with the address and chain. Searches only for full matches.

200.description: Contract is available in the repository

404.description: Contract is not available in the repository

get.summary: (Deprecated) Get the first 200 contract addresses verified on a chain (full or partial match)
get.description: Returns the first 200 verified contracts from the repository for the desired chain. Searches for full and partial matches. This endpoint is deprecated and only retuns 200 addresses. Use `/files/contracts/any/` and `/files/contracts/full/` instead

200.description: Chain is available as a full match or partial match in the repository

400.description: Cannot use this API if there are more than 200 contracts

error.example: Cannot fetch more than 200 contracts (1521 full matches, 3453 partial matches), please use /contracts/{full|any}/4 with pagination

404.description: Chain is not available as both full match or partial match in the repository

get.summary: Get the contract addresses verified on a chain (full or partial match)
get.description: Returns the verified contracts from the repository for the desired chain. Searches for full and partial matches. API is paginated. Limit must be a number between 1 and 200.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Order of the results. Default is "asc" (earliest verified contract first)

200.description: Chain is available as a full match or partial match in the repository

get.summary: Get the contract addresses perfectly verified on a chain
get.description: Returns the perfectly verified contracts from the repository for the desired chain. API is paginated. Limit must be a number between 1 and 200.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Order of the results. Default is "asc" (earliest verified contract first)

200.description: Chain is available as a full match in the repository

get.summary: Get file tree (full and partial match)
get.description: Returns repository URLs for every file in the source tree for the desired chain and address. Searches for full and partial matches.

200.description: Contract is available

get.summary: Get file tree (full match)
get.description: Returns repository URLs for every file in the source tree for the desired chain and address. Searches only for full matches.

200.description: Contract is available

get.summary: Get session data

200.description: OK
OK

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Remote file URL

parameters.name: dryrun
parameters.description: Dry-run flag. When present and set to true, a successful verification result will not be stored in the repository.

200.description: Response is sent when the upload is successful under different conditions.

error.example: Too much session memory used. Delete some files or clear the session.

post.summary: Import deployed contract trying to fetch metadata and files form IPFS

200.description: Response is sent when the upload is successful under different conditions.

error.example: Too much session memory used. Delete some files or clear the session.

parameters.name: dryrun
parameters.description: Dry-run flag. When present and set to true, a successful verification result will not be stored in the repository.

200.description: OK

error.example: There are currently no pending contracts.

200.description: OK

error.example: There are currently no pending contracts.

200.description: OK

oneOf.example: Etherscan API rate limit reached, try later
This contract is not verified on Etherscan

post.summary: Change the logging level of the application
post.description: Allows changing the logging level dynamically at runtime for the application. Requires Basic Authentication.

level.description: The new logging level to set.

200.description: The logging level was successfully changed.

400.description: Bad request (e.g., invalid logging level provided).

401.description: Unauthorized (missing or invalid Basic Authentication credentials).
